alma.scheduling.planning_mode_sim.define
Interface Clock

All Known Implementing Classes:
ClockBase
public interface Clock

The Clock interface provides the current time, the precise geographical location of the clock and time zone information. It also provides methods for synchronizing the system time and the array time, as well as setting alarms, i.e. methods that provide for a notification at a particular time.

Version:
1.00 Jun 3, 2003
Author:
Allen Farris

Method Detail

setClockCoordinates

public void setClockCoordinates(double lng,
                                double lat,
                                int zone)
Set the coordinates of the clock, by specifying the geographical coordinates of the clock.

Parameters:
lng - The longitude in degrees West (i.e., degrees west of Greenwich are positive).
lat - The latitude in degrees North.
zone - The local time zone relative to UT, i.e., the number of hours between the local time zone and UT, i.e., localTime - UT. If the local time zone is ahead of Greenwich mean time, then zone should be positive. If the local time zone is behind Greenwich mean time, then zone should be negative. For example, 9:00 Mountain Daylight Time is 15:00 UT, so if the local time is MDT, zone is -6;

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Convert this DateTime to a string in FITS format that corresponds to the local time.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

getDateTime

public DateTime getDateTime()
Return the current time as an DateTime object. This time is an approximation to the array time. It uses the current system time and adds a delta to it to synchronize it to the array time.

Returns:
The current time as an DateTime object.

getTimeOfDay

public double getTimeOfDay()
Return the current time of day in hours, where 0.0 <= hours < 24.0.

Returns:
The current time of day in hours, where 0.0 <= hours < 24.0.

getJD

public double getJD()
Return the Julian day.

Returns:
The Julian day as a double.

getArrayTime

public ArrayTime getArrayTime()
Return the array time. This time is from the control system, if this is real; if it is a simulation, then it is from the clock simulator.

Returns:
The current time as an ArrayTime object.

getTimeZone

public int getTimeZone()
Get the time zone of the clock, which is the local time zone relative to UT, i.e., the number of hours between the local time zone and UT, i.e., localTime - UT. If the local time zone is ahead of Greenwich mean time, then time zone is positive. If the local time zone is behind Greenwich mean time, then time zone is negative. For example, 9:00 Mountain Daylight Time is 15:00 UT, so if the local time is MDT, the time zone is -6;

Returns:
The time zone of the clock.

getConvertToUT

public double getConvertToUT()
Get the conversion factor from local time to UT, i.e., the factor, in units of fractions of a day, that must be added to local time to get UT.

Returns:
The conversion factor from local time to UT, i.e., the factor, in units of fractions of a day, that must be added to local time to get UT.

Synchronize the currrent system time and the array time.

setAlarm

public void setAlarm(DateTime time,
                     ClockAlarmListener listener)
Set an alarm, to go off at a particular time.

Parameters:
time - The time at which the alarm goes off.
listener - The listener method to call to process the alarm.

setAlarm

public void setAlarm(int seconds,
                     ClockAlarmListener listener)
Set an alarm, to go off at N seconds from now.

Parameters:
seconds - The number of seconds to wait for the alarm to go off.
listener - The listener method to call to process the alarm.
